column4: I have to run some kind of file, i typed sudo /<directory>/ but it says there is no such command as sudo: /<directory>/. If i type the directory without sudo, it says i have no permissions :S

I have to run some kind of file, i typed sudo /<directory>/ but it says there is no such command as sudo: /<directory>/. If i type the directory without sudo, it says i have no permissions :S How can i run it then?

I have to run some kind of file, i typed sudo /<directory>/ but it says there is no such command as sudo: /<directory>/. If i type the directory without sudo, it says i have no permissions :S How can i run it then?
usually means you typed a nonexistent directory...what's the exact command you used?
